projects.name: Coursera
projects.description: I joined the Coursera Mobile team and worked on a bunch of cool projects, from building support for Peer review assesments to building a new main page and accomplishments page

projects.name: Enflick
projects.description: At Enflick I worked as part of the android team on the Textnow app. It was an incredible experience, I learned a ton, and got to design and code super cool things

projects.name: TechRetreat
projects.description: I was one of the organizers of TechRetreat as well as a teacher for our Learnathon. In less than ten hours kids with no prior coding experience were writing working Ruby AIs for TechTanks

projects.name: Army Commander
projects.description: Create and control an army using custom or preset gestures for different formations and actions. Enemies work together and form groups to defend themselves

projects.name: TechTanks
projects.description: Write a ruby AI to control a tank, then test against your friends programs, all in your browser with no setup. Made for TechRetreat Learnathon

projects.name: 3D Viewer
projects.description: Takes sets of connected 3D points and draws them onto a canvas. Walk and jump using screen controls and look around by rotating phone. Coded from scratch using only Android Canvas

projects.name: Swipler
projects.description: Chrome extention that use the doppler effect to detect hand gestures using your laptops mic and speakers. Switches/removes tabs when you swipe different directions

projects.name: IntoxicMate
projects.description: Uses your location, time, heart-rate etc over time to guess when you are intoxicated. IntoxicMate will then help guide you home, call a cab, or in emergencies call friends/family

projects.name: MyoGuitar
projects.description: Use the Myo to play a virtual guitar on your android device. Detects strums when you have your hand closed and uses your fingers positions to play chords on the phone

projects.name: War of Myths
projects.description: Play as a mage and explore the world. Enemies path and search around obstacles, dodge harm, and guess your movement. Started in grade 6 as a flash game, written for android in grade 11

projects.name: EngSoc
projects.description: At Uwaterloo I help out the Engineering Society as an Ambassador, Director, Orientation Leader, and First Year Mentor, as well as helping with specific events

projects.name: SIPOFoundation
projects.description: In Toronto I got to be part of an organization aiming to Inspire and Equip young professionals. I webmastered and helped with SIPOConference and SIPOWorkshops

projects.name: Ontario Science Centre
projects.description: After spending second semester grade 12 studying at the OSC, I also got a chance to work there as a Host, interacting with visitors and helping with shows

projects.name: Portfolio Site
projects.description: The first website I ever made, my portfolio has gone through many variations since, from the Original to my first attempt at using Material Design

projects.name: Find Me
projects.description: Create and share item lists with your friends through their email. People on a list can move and search for items, display list contents, and add or delete items

projects.name: Aaron Z Music
projects.description: My brothers website, still under developement and needs to be filled with content, the structure has all been finished though

projects.name: Flash Games
projects.description:
A collection of old as2 and as3 flash games made around grade 5 to 8

Follow the link to read descriptions, and play

projects.name: Ring Manager
projects.description: Create sets of ring/vibration settings for different times/days, for example Work: 9-5 Mon-Fri. The current active set decides notification actions for certain contacts or groups

projects.name: Myro Security
projects.description: Built a security system using the myro robot. When someone enetered your house, the Myro would send a passcode to your phone. If the code was not shown to the robot in time, the police were called
